did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Office of Intercultural Affairs Reference collection 2000-ongoing
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: The Office of Intercultural Affairs Reference Collection contains files of proceedings, reports, brochures and other materials. This collection was compiled from a variety of sources by the University Archives for use in reference and research.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the University Archives to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: Copyright for Official University records is held by Duke University; all other copyright is retained by the authors of items in these papers, or their descendants, as stipulated by United States copyright law.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Office of Intercultural Affairs Reference Collection, Duke University Archives, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The Office of Intercultural Affairs Reference Collection was compiled by University Archives for use in reference and research.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Descriptive sources and standards used to create this inventory: DACS, EAD, NCEAD guidelines, and local Style Guide.
This finding aid is NCEAD compliant.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Office of Intercultural Affairs evolved out of a series of offices established to address concerns of minority populations, primarily of undergraduates attending Duke University. Some predecessor offices included the Office of Black Affairs, and the Office of Minority Affairs, and the Center for Multicultural Affairs.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Proceedings, brochures, agendas and other materials pertaining to the history, mission and operation of the Office. Proceedings of "Unity through Diversity" functions constitute the bulk.
